content: inspiration www plymouthyarn com increase round *k13 m1 repeat from * across 140 sts on needle switch to larger circular needle work horseshoe lace rnds 1-8 five times then work rnds 1-3 once more work horseshoe lace decrease rnds 1-7 moving the m over 1 st to the right on rnds 2 4 and 6 switch to dpns when there are too few sts to fit comfortably on the circular 56 sts on needle next round move the m over 1 st to the right *p3tog k1 repeat from * across 28 sts on needle next round k2tog across 14 sts on needle next round k2tog across 7 sts on needle next round k1 *k2tog repeat from * across 4 sts on needle cut yarn leaving a 4 tail thread tapestry needle and gather remaining sts pull tight and fasten_off weave in all ends and block to measurements use a circular dinner plate to block the damp hat to create a beret-look let it air dry before removing ©2015 plymouth yarn company 091815vle designed by vanessa ewing abbreviations beg= begin ning co= cast on cont= continue dpns=double pointed needles increase- increase k- knit kf&b= knit into the front and back of stitch k2tog= knit two sts together m1=make one m= marker mm= millimeter pm/pm= place marker p= purl p3tog= purl three sts together psso= pass slipped stitch over repeat= repeat round=round sl= slip ssk = slip 1 st as if to knit slip a second st as if to knit knit them together through the back loop sl= slip st s = stitch es st st = stockinette st decrease = together yo= yarn over
